column4: Hello, where do I set the root passwd in ubuntu? I'm not used to a distro without an active root
don't run 'sudo passwd', read what the bot sent you first
system > preferences > screen resolution first, if it isn't listed there, see !fixres
unzip
you buy it
yeah, well I was thinking about some other package some guy in here talked about the other day.. Some photoshop Open Source solution :-) With all the photoshop options
oh, well if you remember what it was called, I'd like to know too :)
I'd tell you that if I knew instead of coming around with a grumpy "buy it" comment :-P
D:
what does 'file name_of_file.tar.gz' say?
I will paste it now
gnomefreak apokryphos and kbrooks: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/12736
gunzip the file and then run 'file' on it again
when you did gunzip, you should end up with file.tar.  Did you do 'file file.tar' then?
gunzip file.tar.gz
hehe.. got it now :-9 thanks a lot
it is still a tar though?
it changed from tar.gz to tar, and then I was able to tar -zxvf it :-)
k
looks like someone gzipped it twice
sudo fdisk -l
